directions: Melt butter and olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Saute leeks, onion, garlic, bay leaves, and coriander in hot butter and oil until softened and translucent, about 7 minutes. Add potatoes and chicken bouillon to the pot and pour enough chicken stock over the top to cover vegetables. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.

Mash potatoes to desired consistency with a potato masher. Stir Colby-Monterey Jack cheese and cream into potato mixture, return soup to a simmer, and cook until cheese melts and soup is hot, about 15 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. Remove and discard bay leaves.
Ladle soup into bowls and top with chives.
ingredients: 5 russet potatoes, cut into bite-size pieces
1 quart chicken stock, or as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1/4 cup chopped fresh chives, or more to taste
title: Cheesy Potato Leek Soup
